messages: 3d57ed3fac066fa4f8a52432db51c019 (05:10): what permissions would i need for /var/www/ ?
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (05:11): fajita: file permissions
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (05:11): DrBacchus: file permissions is a foreign concept to Windows
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (05:12): Pfft
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (05:12): Directories need to be +rx and files need to be +r
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (05:12): By the Apache user.
3d57ed3fac066fa4f8a52432db51c019 (05:13): so apache needs to own them?
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (05:14): No, Apache should absolutely not own them
3d57ed3fac066fa4f8a52432db51c019 (05:14): ok, im looking at all the files in /var/www and there owned by root
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (05:15): Yes, that's good.
3d57ed3fac066fa4f8a52432db51c019 (05:15): ie, wordpress needs a lighter side of this
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (05:15): permissions

b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (05:15): Files need to be readable by the Apache user (e.g. 644).  Directories and scripts need the X bit too (e.g. 755).  That includes *all* parent directories of a resource.  If you have a symlink, check both the source and target or If you have AllowOverride for an unreadable directory, the error
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (05:15): ..message will refer to .htaccess.  See also selinux
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (05:16): although that's not entirely complete...
3d57ed3fac066fa4f8a52432db51c019 (05:16): 644 and 755, great ty
3d57ed3fac066fa4f8a52432db51c019 (05:16): chmod 644 dir?  its been awhile
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (05:17): 644 regular files, 755 dirs and executable scripts
3d57ed3fac066fa4f8a52432db51c019 (05:17): ty, chmod right?
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (05:17): actually 711 can be used for the parent dirs of the docroot, while the docroot and it's subdirs needs to be 755
1682e17a6f6c4790c8d337ed1ca5acaa (05:18): fajita: chmod
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (05:18): DrBacchus: chmod is http://catcode.com/teachmod/ or http://wsabstract.com/script/script2/chmodcal.shtml
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (05:18): woo hoo! interview for tomorrow got deleted!
